abstracts.cdata!:
The China Shandong Power Plant Flue Gas
            Desulfurization Project was rated as follows: outcomes were
            unsatisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate,
            and both Bank and borrower performance were unsatisfactory.
            The lessons learned during this project are - (1) A project
            supporting mandatory targets should carefully time project
            support with the targets' timeline. (2) Early
            communication to the final borrowers of the Bank's
            project cycle and timing of availability of funding is
            needed, especially when working with corporations. (3)
            Advance procurement of technical assistance, on a
            retroactively financed basis, and greater attention to final
            recipients of the technical assistance could mitigate risks
            of poor loan-financed TA execution. (4) Strong project
            management units are needed to support finance bureaus in
            supervising multiple subprojects. (5) The Bank needs to be
            more proactive and clearer on initiating project restructuring.
